sentences: The March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom was one of the largest political <<||>> for human rights in United States history and <<||>> civil and economic rights for African Americans. It took place in Washington, D.C. Thousands of Americans <<||>> to Washington on Tuesday August 27, 1963. On Wednesday, August 28, 1963, Martin Luther King, Jr., standing in front of the Lincoln Memorial, delivered his historic 'I Have a Dream' speech in which <<||>> for an end to racism. The march was organized by A. Philip Randolph and Bayard Rustin, who built an <<||>> of civil rights, labor, and religious organizations that came together <<||>> of 'jobs and freedom'. Estimates of the number of <<||>> varied from 200,000 to 300,000; the most widely cited estimate is 250,000 people. Observers <<||>> that 75–80% of the marchers were black. The march is credited with helping <<||>> the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and preceded the Selma Voting Rights Movement which <<||>> the passage of the Voting Rights Act of 1965. Via Wikipedia.org.
name: March on Washington
